articles.headline: For Pilots, Dreams Run Into Reality
articles.snippet: The hope of landing a high-paying job as an airline pilot is proving a more elusive dream, as would-be pilots find prestige and salaries continuing to plummet.
articles.abstract: The hope of landing a high-paying job as an airline pilot is proving a more elusive dream, as would-be pilots find prestige and salaries continuing to plummet.
articles.lead_paragraph: IRVING, Tex.  Among the jobs little boys dream of  policeman, fireman, bulldozer driver  airline pilot long held the added virtue of satisfying grown-up dreams: pay that reached $300,000 a year, 20 days a month off work, the prestige of one day commanding a $200 million airplane, and a lush retirement at 60.

articles.headline: Vying Hard to Claim Tiny Crown
articles.snippet: Panasonic, Sony and Sanyo all say they have introduced the world’s smallest full high-definition camcorder.
articles.abstract: Panasonic, Sony and Sanyo all say they have introduced the world’s smallest full high-definition camcorder.
articles.lead_paragraph: Well, this ought to be good.

articles.headline: New Delays Loom as F.A.A. Expands Airliner Review
articles.snippet: Chaos at airports could go on for weeks as the Federal Aviation Administration and the airlines expand their scrutiny of planes.
articles.abstract: Chaos at airports could go on for weeks as the Federal Aviation Administration and the airlines expand their scrutiny of planes.
articles.lead_paragraph: Air travelers, whose plans have already been disrupted by thousands of canceled flights recently, may face continued chaos in coming weeks as the Federal Aviation Administration and the airlines expand their scrutiny of passenger planes.
articles.byline: By Micheline Maynard and Matthew L. Wald

articles.headline: News Corp. May Join Yahoo Bid With Microsoft
articles.snippet: Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation is in talks with Microsoft about joining in its contested bid for Yahoo, according to people involved in the discussions.
articles.abstract: Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation is in talks with Microsoft about joining in its contested bid for Yahoo, according to people involved in the discussions.
articles.lead_paragraph: Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation is in talks with Microsoft about joining in its contested bid for Yahoo, according to people involved in the discussions. The combination, which would join Yahoo, Microsoft’s MSN and News Corporation’s MySpace, would create a behemoth that would upend the Internet landscape.
articles.byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Miguel Helft

articles.headline: Housing Aid Advancing in Congress
articles.snippet: Although Congress and the Bush administration are clashing over how to help struggling homeowners, they seem united around the need for government action.
articles.abstract: Although Congress and the Bush administration are clashing over how to help struggling homeowners, they seem united around the need for government action.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Congress and the Bush administration clashed on Wednesday over how best to help homeowners in danger of foreclosure but seemed to unite around the need for additional government action.

articles.headline: 2 Camps Trying to Influence McCain on Foreign Policy
articles.snippet: A component of the fractious G.O.P. foreign policy establishment is concerned that John McCain is falling under the sway of a competing camp, the neoconservatives.
articles.abstract: A component of the fractious G.O.P. foreign policy establishment is concerned that John McCain is falling under the sway of a competing camp, the neoconservatives.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Senator John McCain has long made his decades of experience in foreign policy and national security the centerpiece of his political identity, and suggests he would bring to the White House a fully formed view of the world.
articles.byline: By Elisabeth Bumiller and Larry Rohter

articles.headline: Names That Match Forge a Bond on the Internet
articles.snippet: Why do so many feel a connection — be it kinship or competition — just because they share a name?
articles.abstract: Why do so many feel a connection — be it kinship or competition — just because they share a name?
articles.lead_paragraph: From time to time Sam Blackman, a pediatric oncologist in Philadelphia, checks up on people other than patients. Namely, other Sam Blackmans.

articles.headline: Fuel Costs Just Part of Airlines’ List of Woes
articles.snippet: Even before the recent flight cancellations, airlines and passengers were facing a new wave of travel misery.
articles.abstract: Even before the recent flight cancellations, airlines and passengers were facing a new wave of travel misery.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even before the recent flight cancellations, airlines and passengers were facing a new wave of travel misery.
